column2: DeeD, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had a severe positional vertego attack could not move for three days, by ambulance to er, after no relief from meclizine ect. given iv inj of inapsine 1.25mg almost instant relief , could actually walk, turn my head Was foggy headed and blurry eyed but ok, for few hours, that night had another attach. this medicine was like a miracle for me at least for awhile.dont know if they make it in pill form.

column2: rojo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My teenage daughter suffers from debilitating migraines.  They are so bad that we have to take her to the ER to get relief when her rescue meds fail.  The doctors have tried so many different meds via IV but to no avail, especially when she gets stabbing pain.  Finally one doctor tried Inapsine as a last resort.  What a difference!  The pain stopped almost immediately, she smiled and walked out on her own, not needing a wheelchair.  For my daughter, this has been a miracle drug. She has had no adverse effects other than sleepiness.  She has had to have it two more times and again, no adverse effects. I realize that it has effected others adversely, but it does work miracles for some.

column2: 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Horrible.  Was given inapsine for nausea and now have more problems than I went in to the ER to begin with.

column2: tedddybear4201979, 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: I could not sit still and went into such a panic that I ended up taking IV out and leaving hospital it freaked me out terrible experience willNEVER take that drug again

column2: christopherderaad@hotmail.com, 25-34 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is from hell, I was given it to treat a cluster headache, which it did not help, but within 10 minutes of getting the injection and ever since then i have been restless, constant involuntary movement of the legs, rapid heart rate on and off, sometime my heart beats so fast that it hurts. and its been a week now, i have slept a total of 13 hours in the last week due to this. Its caused sever depression and mood swings, in an otherwise happy person. This drug needs to be removed from the market. seems VERY dangerous. I am actually going to head into the ER in a little bit to see if they have anything they can do to make this stop. If they can't I am going to find a lawyer

column2: Indiana Jones, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was in the ER for heart arrhythmia, pain, and a severe headache.  The doctor thought I was anxious, as well, but I am just normally a fast talker and I was in pain.The ER doctor gave me this medication and said it was for pain.  Apparently, this is not a pain medication.Within 5 minutes, I was having difficulty breathing and became out of touch with reality.  I became very agitated with restless leg, tachycardia, and confusion.  I felt I was going to pass out or die. This medication was derived in Hell.My ER doctor was not being honest in why he administered this medication.Patients NEED to ask "why" before medications are administered.  We have the right.

column2: scouter, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: My son had severe allergic reaction with convulsive muscle spasms. Had to be treated with medication to counter the reaction. Don't understand why it was used when there were other safer alternatives. Scared me to death!

column1: Nausea and Vomiting During an Operation
column2: alie6608, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had a dystonic reaction and all my muscles became really tense and i ended up staring at the ceiling for hours, my throat also started to close. I do not recomend this medication to anyone

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for less than 1 month
column9: Had an awful dystonic/LONG QT issue - EVEN after it was black boxed, ban the drug already.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Had severe reaction to drug.  stared at ceiling for hours.  left side in spasm.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG

column2: 45-54 Male  (Caregiver)
column9: Excellent first line postoperative antiemetic.  When given in doses of 0.625-1.25 mg there are no cardiac problems.

column2: 35-44 Female  (Patient)
column9: I was in the ER with a severe migraine. I was given this drug and within seconds felt this horrible sense of doom or depression and then very anxious. I could not stop moving my legs or arms but it was this internal feeling of anxiety that is hard to explain but almost unbearable.  I had to supress the urge to rip off the IV..I will make sure I NEVER am given this drug again.

column2: 45-54 on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was told in the ER that I was given this med in combination with Benydryl for pain and inflammation for pancreatitis. I was actually dehydrated and receiving IV fluids as well. I felt extremely restless and wired immediately after receiving this med.  I would never want it again based on this very uncomfortable reaction.

column2: Lexie, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Went to ER because of severe abdominal pains. Started vomiting at ER and they gave me a shot of Inapsine. Apparently, it stopped my vomiting but it wiped out my memory of about 12 hour prior and about six hours around shot. Because of pain had stopped, I kept asking why am I in the hospital. They were going to proceed with surgery until the anestheologist realized that I didn't remember him telling me why I was there and the planned surgery. I still have no recall of driving to hospital or the pain that I was going thru that caused me to call my doctor, who advised me to get to the hospital. Because I was unable to remember what they told me a few minutes earlier, they did an MRI to see if I had had a stroke. I lost all memory of about 15 hours and learned what had happened from my doctor. I would never knowlingly accept this drug again. If I consented to it at the time, I have no recall.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: went to er with concussion, and muscle strain of my neck and side. I was in terrible pain. one shot of inapsine im(it took almost an hour to work) but took all my pain and spasms away

column2: bbdrag0n, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug was used on me when I had my tonsils out as an adult. Violent reaction to this. Skin crawling, sweats, anxiety, excess energy (not good after having tonsils out). I never want to take this drug again.

column2: lovingspouse, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: Spouse given this drug for nausea in ER.  Within minutes began having adverse reaction, strong anxiety, hallucination, tearing out IV in order to escape and screaming for help.  When nurse advised, they administered benedryl and commented that sometimes this drug can cause "LSD-type trips and people begin climbing the walls."  Nurse made it sound like no big deal!  VERY frightening and has changed his life dramatically since then.  Now suffers depression, anxiety, seizure-like spells, all from this terrible anti-nausea drug that is given regularly in ERs. If any drug side effects are like a bad LSD trip, it should be removed from the market!! BE VERY AWARE before getting this drug.

column2: JerriM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was given this drug after going to the ER for chest pain and had a sever reaction. I could not even tell my husband who was beside me that I needed help. I looked and felt like I was having a seizure my muscles drew up and my tongue swelled finally when I got his attention the Dr. gave me Benadryl to counter act. Please use caution BEFORE getting this Med.

column2: mlpwjp, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Uncontrolled leg muscle spasms for 4 hours after surgery; all I wanted to do was sleep but that was impossible.  When I told the nurse I NEVER WANTED IT AGAIN she tried to convince me otherwise.  When I spoke to the doctor he agreed that the drug didn't have to be used.

column2: frantic, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Several years ago, I was taken to the ER due to constant N/V after GI surgery, seems I had an Ileus.  But Phenergan suppositories were not helping and they decided to try Inapsine.  BIG MISTAKE.  As soon as they gave it IVP,  I begin to have trouble breathing, trouble swallowing, and basically looked like I was having a stroke.  I almost broke my teeth from the constant grinding and I just knew they were going to have to put me on the ventilator because I couldn't breath. But finally they started another IV, gave me 2 kinds of meds and oxygen before it got better.  Never want to do that again.

column2: happyfeets88@aol.com, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Inapsine: People,Be very aware!!I was administered Inapsine via ER visit.And had a violent reaction that has changed my life as I knew it.I now have serious problems that are getting worse with time,involentary movements heart and chest pain, etc,etc.to many to mention. This drug needs to be taken off the market,I imagine it will be very soon. I have to struggle for my breath even now. I was abandon in a er room and left for what I thought, to die, I fought for every breath for several hours which went unnoticed by hospital staff.I fight to breath an function today.What happened to me is criminal.I dont even know the full extent of the damage but am being treated finally at my costs.IM in a state of trauma and distress, and not to mention sepic shock, my hair fell out, I am afraid of dying each time I lay down to try to sleep,still, as my heart and lungs now stop all the time and put me in a sudden survival mode,.What happened is more than I can say here and now.It is the nightmare of nightmares to go thru and continue to . Its been  years sinse the drug .. I dont think I will make it, I am planning my esate and will as I dont know what else to do.please warn friends and do not take this drug!

column2: LLM, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been using this for treatment for Vertigo as prescribed by my ENT doctor. This is the first time I have felt normal in 4 months after having vertigo for that long. I use it under my tongue, 4 drops, twice a day. It has been wonderful and I feel normal again.
